title: Quick Grammar Question
content:
Do you write?:

detail-oriented

or just

detail oriented

I’m doing a resume and I’m not sure about this detail.

Mikey :-)
author: SuperUltraFabulous

comments.content: It's detail-oriented. Detail oriented might lead to confusing modifiers (thus, ambiguity) in the sentence.
No problem. I was surprised that it took so long for anyone to actually answer your inquiry.

Actually, the answer isn't quite right. Multiple adjectives before a noun are hyphenated:

<cite>This is my long-range rifle.</cite>

If they are put after the noun, no hyphen:

<cite>This is the rifle I shoot at long range.</cite>

BTW, everyone is detail oriented. What's important is what details they are interested in. Only a certified compulsive is interested in all of them. Most companies don't hire \*certified\* compulsives.
